citeinfo.origin: Spatial Analysis Center, Yellowstone National Park
citeinfo.title: Fire Perimeters (from 1881 to 2008) in Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming, Montana, Idaho

descript.abstract: This map depicts the perimeters of fires in Yellowstone National Park (YNP) larger than 100 acres from 1881-2003. Due to increased availability of better mapping technologies and products, 2004 to present perimeters may include fires less than 100 acres in size. YNP fire files were researched by NPS firefighter/researcher Bob Flather. Superintendent and other reports were researched from 1881-1930 for maps and locational accounts of large fires. Individual Forest Fire Reports forms 1931-1970 were researched, entered into a database and queried for sizes larger than 100 acres. Shared Applications Computer System (SACS) database was queried for fires larger than 100 acres. Fire perimeters from Don Despain's Pre 1988 covertype/fire history were combined with other historic perimeter maps including Roy Renkin's master map, historic and other maps. Fire perimeters for 2000 through 2003 were derived from NBR satellite imagery by comparing areas before and a year after burns to detect change. All fires larger than 100 acres were matched with a perimeter map and attributed with a unique identifier for linking with future databases for each fire. **1988 Data for this dataset was created using Normalized Burn Ratio imagery product combinted with "Burned Area Survey" layer for the park. This combination gives a more accurate representation of unburned areas within the park, but most likely under- represents non-forested burn outside the park. This data layer is in process and has not cleared a final QA/QC.
descript.purpose: The primary objective of this mapping effort was to produce a GIS fire perimeter layer of all fires larger than 100 acres. Using a unique ID this GIS layer could later be linked to a historic fire database to aid in the development of models and analysis.

place.placekt: United States of America, USA, US, North America
place.placekey: National Park Service, NPS, Department of the Interior, DOI, US Government

Yellowstone National Park, YNP, YELL, Greater Yellowstone Area, GYA, Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem, GYE, Park County, Teton County, Fremont County, Gallatin County, Montana, Idaho, Wyoming, Northern Rocky Mountains

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 2002 Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3 Build 1770

attracc.attraccr: Features were obtained from ground truthing and heads up digitizing. Polygons were later checked and updated from NBR satellite imagery. Attribute information was entered manually and checked against fire history data layers.

dataqual.logic: Data checked for missing attribute labels. Polygons checked for sliver and gap polygons.

horizpa.horizpar: Various and unknown methods of mapping were used to initially record these historic fires.

procstep.procdesc: Research and query of Fire Records to identify fires larger than 100 acres for 1931-1971.
Fire Perimeters digitized from Roy Renkin's Master Map in the Bear Office.
Query of SACS fire records for fires larger than 100 acres 1972 - 2000.
Fire perimeters acquired for those fires not shown on Roy's master map.
Fire perimeters merged into one shapefile and attributed with unique identifier to link with fire records.
Researcher, Bob Flathers, wrote descriptions of large fires mentioned in Superintendent and other reports previous to 1931.
Fire Perimeters for 2000 through 2002 were updated with digitized boundaries from NBR satellite imagery.

cntorgp.cntorg: Spatial Analysis Center - Yellowstone National Park

cntinfo.hours: 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.(Mountain Time) Monday Through Friday
cntinfo.cntinst: Please check web site first: http://www.nps.gov/yell/technical/gis

procstep.procdesc: Fire Perimeters for 2003 were updated with digitized boundaries from NBR satellite imagery.
Fire perimeters for the two fires in 2005 that had any acreage (Elk Tongue = 33; Chickadee = 80) were added.
Fire perimeters for the two fires in 2006 that had any acreage (Magpie = 3235 and Stinky = 1010) were added.
Fire perimeters for those fires in 2007 that had any acreage were added.

Data for 1988 was removed, as it was created using a maximum daily perimeter (drawn on hardcopy maps). This data layer remains as the progression layer for the 1988 fires, but NBR Imagery was used in combination with the "Burned Area Survey" data to create a layer more representative of the burned mosaic in the park. **1988 Data for this map was created using Normalized Burn Ratio imagery product combinted with "Burned Area Survey" layer for the park. This combination gives a more accurate representation of unburned areas within the park, but most likely under-represents non-forested burn outside the park. This data layer is in process and has not cleared a final QA/QC.
Fire perimeters for those fires in 2008 that had any acreage were added.

attr.attrdef: Source used for fire perimeter data
Year in which the fire started
attr.attrdefs: Item 3c on NPS edited version, DI-1202 Individual Fire Report (12/1994); referenced as CALENDAR YEAR in SACS

attrdomv.udom: Year in which the fire started

attr.attrdef: Yellowstone's unique ID for each fire; developed by combining the official fire number with the fire year
Feature geometry.
Unique ID for each fire; created by concatenating [UNIT_ID] + [YEAR] + [FIRE_NUM]
attr.attrdefs: Proposed NPS Fire GIS Data Standards

attr.attrdef: Name of Fire
attr.attrdefs: Item 9a on NPS edited version, DI-1202 Individual Fire Report (12/1994); Referenced as FIRE NAME in SACS

attrvai.attrva: This attribute was obtained from the SACS database for Yellowstone. The database contains fire data from 1972 on and therefore for fires prior to 1972 attribute information was obtained from hardcopy maps and records. If the attributes in SACS varied from the hardcopy reports and maps then attribute information reflects the hardcopy documents.

attr.attrdef: Yellowstone's fire name.
Interagency unit identifier; comprised of 2 letter state abbreviation and 3 letter unit abbreviation
attr.attrdefs: Proposed NPS Fire GIS Data Standards

edom.edomvd: The first two letters of the state of Wyoming and the first three letters of the park name, Yellowstone

attr.attrdef: Local Unit Fire Number. This attribute was obtained from the SACS database for Yellowstone. The database contains fire data from 1972 on and therefore fires prior to 1972 do not have this attribute information.
attr.attrdefs: Item 3d on NPS edited version, DI-1202 Individual Fire Report (12/1994); Referenced as FIRE NUMBER in SACS

attr.attrdef: Fire Type (1st digit) concatenated with Protection Type (2nd digit) as recorded on DI-1202 report. This attribute was obtained from the SACS database for Yellowstone. The database contains fire data from 1972 on and therefore fires prior to 1972 do not have this attribute information.
attr.attrdefs: Item 4 on NPS edited version, DI-1202 Individual Fire Report (12/1994); Referenced as FIRE TYPE in SACS

edom.edomvd: Suppression - Wildfire inside park was suppressed by NPS
edom.edomvds: See document, "Instructions For Completing National Park Service Edited Version of DI-1202, Individual Fire Report." December 14, 1994.

edom.edomvd: Suppression - Wildfire inside park was suppressed by another federal agency
edom.edomvds: See document, "Instructions For Completing National Park Service Edited Version of DI-1202, Individual Fire Report." December 14, 1994.

edom.edomvd: Suppression - Wildfire inside park was suppressed by non-federal agency
edom.edomvds: See document, "Instructions For Completing National Park Service Edited Version of DI-1202, Individual Fire Report." December 14, 1994.

edom.edomvd: Suppression - Wildfire that occurred on NPS land was confined to a specific area without full suppression
edom.edomvds: See document, "Instructions For Completing National Park Service Edited Version of DI-1202, Individual Fire Report." December 14, 1994.

edom.edomvd: Mutual Aid - NPS resources take suppression action on adjoining state land
edom.edomvds: See document, "Instructions For Completing National Park Service Edited Version of DI-1202, Individual Fire Report." December 14, 1994.

edom.edomvd: Natural Out - Fire inside park is extinquished by weather before NPS resources take suppression action
edom.edomvds: See document, "Instructions For Completing National Park Service Edited Version of DI-1202, Individual Fire Report." December 14, 1994.

edom.edomvd: Management-Ignited Prescribed Fire (e.g., hazard fuel reduction, resources management - prescribed burning) was conducted in park
edom.edomvds: See document, "Instructions For Completing National Park Service Edited Version of DI-1202, Individual Fire Report." December 14, 1994.

edom.edomvd: Prescribed Natural Fire - Occurred inside park and was managed as such within prescription under an approved plan
edom.edomvds: See document, "Instructions For Completing National Park Service Edited Version of DI-1202, Individual Fire Report." December 14, 1994.

Acreage, calculated using ArcGIS "calculate geometry" tool

overview.eaover: ACRES_CALC = total acreage of each polygon; YEAR = year of fire; Y_FIRE_ID = developed by combining the official fire number with the fire year (the first fire in 1988 = 198801). For fires from 1881-1930 fire numbers were assigned according to the size of fire (acres). (The biggest fire of 1881 = 188101) From 1931-2002 official fire numbers were assigned sequentially to all fires according to occurrence during a fire year. Y_FIRE_NAM = taken from records and historic records. SOURCETHM = the source used for each perimeter with the following attributes: "Roy's master map" is on file in the Bear management office, "IFFR" is Individual Forest Fire Reports forms 1931-1970, "f88perim" is the 1988 fires GIS coverage, "15'quadroy" is Roy Renkin's aerial observation digitized from USGS quad , "SACSpoint" is a fire without a map so a circle was drawn at the location from the SACS report, "Roybrian" is a combination of Roy Renkin's aerial observation maps and Brian Sorbel's 1994-1996 landsat coverage, "FirecacheGIS" is arcview shapefiles developed by the YNP fire cache; PERIM_MILE = perimeter of polygons in miles

cntorgp.cntorg: National Park Service, Intermountain GIS Program Office

distinfo.distliab: The National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics ("GIF" format files) are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such. The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. The related graphics are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not appropriate to use the related graphics as data. The National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an NPS server and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the National Park Service, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.
